Imports

httpbeast/parser

Types

Request = object
  selector: Selector[Data]
  client*: posix.SocketHandle
  start: int
  requestID: uint

OnRequest = proc (req: Request): Future[void] {....gcsafe.}
Settings = object
  port*: Port
  bindAddr*: string
  domain*: Domain
  numThreads: Natural
  loggers: seq[Logger]
  reusePort: bool ## controls whether to fail with "Address already in use".
                  ## Setting this to false will raise when `threads` are on.
  
HttpBeastDefect = ref object of Defect

Procs

proc initSettings(port: Port = Port(8080); bindAddr: string = "";
                  numThreads: int = 0; domain = Domain.AF_INET; reusePort = true): Settings {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc unsafeSend(req: Request; data: string) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Sends the specified data on the request socket.

This function can be called as many times as necessary.

It does not check whether the socket is in a state that can be written so be careful when using it.

proc send(req: Request; code: HttpCode; body: string; headers: HttpHeaders) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
proc send(req: Request; code: HttpCode) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Responds with the specified HttpCode. The body of the response is the same as the HttpCode description. 
proc send(req: Request; body: string; code = Http200) {.inline, ...raises: [],
    tags: [].}

Sends a HTTP 200 OK response with the specified body.

Warning: This can only be called once in the OnRequest callback.

proc httpMethod(req: Request): Option[HttpMethod] {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Parses the request's data to find the request HttpMethod. 
proc path(req: Request): Option[string] {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Parses the request's data to find the request target. 
proc headers(req: Request): Option[HttpHeaders] {....raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Parses the request's data to get the headers. 
proc body(req: Request): Option[string] {....raises: [KeyError, ValueError],
    tags: [].}
Retrieves the body of the request. 
proc ip(req: Request): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Retrieves the IP address that the request was made from. 
proc forget(req: Request) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Unregisters the underlying request's client socket from httpbeast's event loop.

This is useful when you want to register req.client in your own event loop, for example when wanting to integrate httpbeast into a websocket library.

proc run(onRequest: OnRequest; settings: Settings) {.
    ...raises: [ValueError, OSError, Exception, KeyError, ResourceExhaustedError],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect].}

Starts the HTTP server and calls onRequest for each request.

The onRequest procedure returns a Future[void] type. But unlike most asynchronous procedures in Nim, it can return nil for better performance, when no async operations are needed.

proc run(onRequest: OnRequest) {.inline, ...raises: [ValueError, OSError,
    Exception, KeyError, ResourceExhaustedError], tags: [WriteIOEffect,
    ReadIOEffect, RootEffect, TimeEffect].}

Starts the HTTP server with default settings. Calls onRequest for each request.

See the other run proc for more info.
